Articles.Content:
Does the game implement orbital decay?

Edited December 12, 2013 by Cdodders
No. As long as you clear the atmosphere at all times, there are no sources of friction or anything else that might cause the alteration of an orbit.
No gravitational radiation, no tidal effects and no solar activity. You do get drag from the atmosphere of a celestial body, but since the height is defined its not much of a problem.

Just to add to Dante, you can aerobrake on celestial bodies that have an atmosphere. Meaning, while you go through the atmosphere you'll see your apoapsis shrink due to change in velocity.

Otherwise I think they got your answer for you
Also, Atmospheric drag only affects the actively controlled ship. If you aren't actively controlling it it get's put on rails and physics no longer applies.
